tool.name: Filter otus from otu table
tool.description: Filter OTUs from an OTU table based on their observation counts or identifier
tool.command: filter_otus_from_otu_table.py --input_fp '$input_fp' --output_fp '$output_fp' #if $min_count != '': --min_count '$min_count' #end if #if $min_count_fraction != '': --min_count_fraction '$min_count_fraction' #end if #if $max_count != '': --max_count '$max_count' #end if #if $min_samples != '': --min_samples '$min_samples' #end if #if $max_samples != '': --max_samples '$max_samples' #end if #if $id_filtering_condition.id_filtering_switch == 'yes': --otu_ids_to_exclude_fp '$id_filtering_condition.otu_ids_to_exclude_fp' $id_filtering_condition.negate_ids_to_exclude #end if

param.label: Input OTU table
param.help: The input otu table filepath in biom format

param.label: Minimum total observation count of an otu for that otu to be retained
Fraction of the total observation (sequence) count to apply as the minimum total observation count of an otu for that otu to be retained
param.help: This is a fraction (float), not a percentage, so if you want to filter to 1%, you need to use 0.01 as value here

param.label: Maximum total observation count of an otu for that otu to be retained
Minimum number of samples an OTU must be observed in for that otu to be retained
Maximum number of samples an OTU must be observed in for that otu to be retained

param.name: id_filtering_switch
param.label: Do you want to exclude a predefined list of OTUs from the OTU table ?
Filtering by ID / Chimera filtering - Input text/Fasta file containing a list of OTU ids to exclude
param.help: The selected file can be a text file with one id per line, a text file where id is the first value in a tab-separated line, or can be a fasta file (extension must be .fna or .fasta)

param.label: Do you want to reverse the filtering by ID / Chimera filtering ?
param.help: When this parameter is set to yes, then only the OTUs listed in the file passed to the --otu_ids_to_exclude_fp parameters will be kept in the output biom file

tool.help:
**What it does**
The Qiime script `filter_otus_from_otu_table.py <http://qiime.org/scripts/filter_otus_from_otu_table.html>`_ filter OTUs from an OTU table based on their observation counts or identifier.
The output of `filter_otus_from_otu_table.py <http://qiime.org/scripts/filter_otus_from_otu_table.html>`_ is a `biom file <http://biom-format.org/>`_.
Different kind of filtering can be applied on the input biom file depending on the selected parameters: - Singleton filtering (minimum number of occurence) by using the -n/--min_count parameters - Abundance filtering (maximum number of occurence) by using the -x/--max_count parameters - Chimera filtering by using the -e/--otu_ids_to_exclude_fp parameters
More information about this tool is available on `QIIME documentation <http://qiime.org/scripts/filter_otus_from_otu_table.html>`_.
